translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about Perfumes and Water
The Elder Who Gave a Grass Hut
“In the city of Bandhumatī,🔽I was a hired worker,

analyzed: para kamma ayane yuttaḥ  parabhattam a passito
translated: Engaged in hired work,🔽Not looking after my own food.
Sitting in private,
I thought like this then:
‘The Buddha has arisen in the world,
But I have no opportunity.
It’s time for me to purify my destiny,
The moment has been presented to me;
The painful contact with hell
Is for those who do bad deeds.’

analyzed: eva aham  kamma sāmiṃ upāgami  eka aham kammam yācitvā
translated: After thinking like this,🔽I went to the employer🔽And asked for a day off.
I entered the forest.

analyzed: tiṇa kaṭṭhañca valliñca  āharitvān aham tadā  tidaṇḍake
translated: Gathering grass, sticks, and vines,🔽I set them up in a three-sided structure
And made a grass hut.
For the sake of the Sangha,🔽I dedicated that hut
And then returned that very day
To the employer.

analyzed: tena kammena su katena  tau atisamagacchaha
translated: By that well-done deed,🔽I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven;
There I enjoyed the results of that deed,
The well-made grass hut.

analyzed: sahassa kaṇḍam sata bheṇḍu  dhajālu haritāmaya
translated: A thousand-piece set of furniture, a hundred-piece set of furniture,🔽a flag, a green-colored cloth,
a hundred thousand pieces of furniture,
appeared to me in the house.

analyzed: yam yam yonupapajjāmi  devattam atha mānusa
translated: Whatever womb I entered,🔽whether divine or human,
understanding my intention,

original: pāsādo upatiṭṭhati.🔽Bhayaṁ vā chambhitattaṁ vā,🔽lomahaṁso na vijjati;
analyzed: pāsādaḥ upatiṭṭhati  bhayam vā chambhitattam vā  loma hasaḥ na vijjati
translated: a palace stood ready.🔽Fear, terror,🔽or the hairs on end never occurred to me.
I do not know their reason,
this is the fruit of my grass hut.
Lions, tigers, and leopards,
peacocks, and taracchakas,
all avoid me,
this is the fruit of my grass hut.
Snakes, spirits,
snakes, kumbhaṇḍas, and rākṣasas,
they too avoid me,

analyzed: tiṇakuṭikāyidam  na pāpa supinaḥ sa api
translated: this is the fruit of my grass hut.🔽I do not remember even a bad dream,
seeing me,
mindfulness is established in me,
this is the fruit of my grass hut.🔽Having experienced the perfection

analyzed: tāya iva tiṇa kuṭikāya  anubhotvāna sampadā
translated: of that very grass hut,
I realized the Dhamma
of the Blessed One, the Fortunate One.
For ninety-one eons,
the deed I did then,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the grass hut.
The four analytical knowledges,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā tiṇakuṭidāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā tiṇakuṭidāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Tiṇakuṭidāyaka recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Tiṇakuṭidāyaka is finished.
